oai_dc:dc.dc:title: The one body density matrix of a quantum bright soliton from the coordinate Bethe ansatz
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Ayet, A.
Brand, J.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematical Physics
Condensed Matter - Quantum Gases
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We present a novel approach for computing reduced density matrices for superpositions of eigenstates of a Bethe-ansatz solvable model by direct integration of the wave function in coordinate representation. A diagrammatic approach is developed to keep track of relevant terms and identify symmetries, which helps to reduce the number of terms that have to be evaluated numerically. As a first application we compute with modest numerical resources the one-body density matrix and its eigenvalues including the condensate fraction for a quantum bright soliton with N = 10 bosons. The latter are constructed as superpositions of string-type Bethe-ansatz eigenstates of nonrelatvistic bosons in one spatial dimension with attractive contact interaction. Upon delocalising the superposition in momentum space we find that the condensate fraction saturates to a value close to one. The presented approach is suitable for studying time-dependent problems and generalises to higher-order correlation functions.
